intro: Erythraea pallida, commonly known as the pale erythraea, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Erythraea pallida is typically found in woodland and rocky habitats, and it thrives in well-drained soils.
